DOC.brief_summary: RATIONALE : Mindfulness-based stress reduction ( MBSR ) may reduce patient stress improve quality life . It yet know whether mindfulness-based stress reduction effective improve immune response human papillomavirus patient cervical dysplasia . PURPOSE : This randomized clinical trial study whether mindfulness-based stress reduction ( MBSR ) general diet physical activity program effect immune response human papillomavirus patient cervical dysplasia .
DOC.brief_title: The Effects MBSR Improving Immune Response Human Papillomavirus Patients With Cervical Dysplasia
DOC.detailed_description: OBJECTIVES : - To evaluate effect standardize mindfulness-based stress reduction ( MBSR ) intervention versus diet physical activity program psychosocial well-being ( e.g. , perceive stress quality life ) post-intervention subsequent follow-up time point . - To evaluate effect MBSR intervention versus diet physical activity program specific immune response HPV ( i.e. , T-cell proliferative response HPV16 intracellular cytokine expression HPV-stimulated T-cells ) post-intervention follow-up time point . - To examine extent change psychosocial well-being mediate effect intervention HPV-specific immune response . - To explore potential mechanism action ( e.g. , self-regulation , expectancy ) propose responsible produce intervention effect psychosocial well-being . OUTLINE : This randomize study . Patients randomize 1 2 treatment arm . - Arm I : Patients undergo mindfulness-based stress reduction intervention ( include meditation technique , body scan , awareness breathing , mindful yoga , eat meditation , walk meditation ) 2 hour , weekly 8 week . - Arm II : Patients undergo diet physical activity program 2 hour , weekly 8 week . In arm , questionnaire measure psychosocial factor , demographic , behavioral risk factor administer patient baseline , within 2 week complete 8-week program , 6 12 month . Treatment continue absence develop cervical cancer . Blood collect immunologic assay . HPV status subtype evaluate cervical specimen use standard real-time PCR technique . Quality Life evaluate baseline , post-intervention , 6 12 month .
DOC.criteria: DISEASE CHARACTERISTICS : Referred colposcopy follow abnormal Pap smear test result Atypical squamous cell undetermined significance/positive human papilloma virus mild moderate dysplasia Referred second opinion OR patient record within medical practice undergo routine recommend followup Recruited Fox Chase Cancer Center Thomas Jefferson University Hospital No history cervical cancer No evidence present invasive carcinoma PATIENT CHARACTERISTICS : Must able read and/or communicate English Not pregnant No known HIV positivity No psychiatric disorder disorder would preclude informed consent PRIOR CONCURRENT THERAPY : Not specify
